## Environment Setup

I know nothing about the dynamic behind, but I successfully set it up. I will introduce the procedure. I completely agree with Dr. Gruber at his post [@gruber2022] :

> I never really found an IDE that I liked. I tried a few different ones including Spyder and Jupyter Notebook (not technically an IDE) and compared to RStudio and R Markdown they felt rather limited. Most Python users I met seem to think IDEs are not really important, which confuses me even further. Thatâ€™s what you look at the entire time while programming!

Once you got familiar with Rstudio, or anyway Posit IDE, you are spoiled, that is how I felt. Therefore, I decide to continue to teach and code in Rstudio, even with python or jupyter-note. I also use Zotero for reference and Typora for slides writing.

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(reticulate)
py_install('pandas')
py_install('matplotlib')
py_install('numpy')
py_install('jupyter')
py_install('scikit-learn')
reticulate::repl_python()
#virtualenv_install('matplotlib')
#os <- import("os")
#os$listdir(".")
#use_python("/opt/homebrew/bin/python3")
py_install('scikit-survival')
```
